xwikidoc.content: <ravigarg27> has quit 00:18 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #phenotips 03:20 <kushalkhandelwal> has quit 04:21 <sdumitriu> has quit 04:23 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 08:39 <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 08:43 <sdumitriu> has quit 10:24 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #phenotips 11:06 <kushalkhandelwal> has quit 11:20 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 12:59 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #phenotips 13:04 <kushalkhandelwal> Hey sdumitriu1 13:04 <kushalkhandelwal> Need to fix net at my place :( 13:04 <kushalkhandelwal> Some issues with network today 13:11 <sdumitriu> has quit 13:14 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 13:15 <sdumitriu> Hm, issues with my network as well 13:15 <sdumitriu> So, kushalkhandelwal, what are you up to? 13:16 <kushalkhandelwal> Was without connectivity 13:16 <kushalkhandelwal> Trying to figure out alternative ways 13:16 <kushalkhandelwal> Would work on Xwiki issue 13:16 <kushalkhandelwal> and issue 429 phenotips 13:18 <sdumitriu> Building XWiki requires some changes to make Maven work properly: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building 13:18 <kushalkhandelwal> Reading this http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing 13:18 <kushalkhandelwal> Oh ok 13:18 <kushalkhandelwal> would follow this 13:19 <kushalkhandelwal> I have maven 3.0.4 on my system 13:35 <kushalk124> has joined #phenotips 13:35 <kushalk124> Hey 13:35 <kushalk124> My network :x 13:36 <kushalkhandelwal> has quit 13:38 <sdumitriu1> has quit 13:39 <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 14:05 <kushalk124> has quit 14:22 <kushalk124> has joined #phenotips 14:23 <kushalk124> is now known as <Guest46993> 14:30 <Guest46993> has quit 15:35 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #phenotips 15:35 <kushalkhandelwal> Hey sdumitriu 15:35 <sdumitriu> Hey 15:35 <kushalkhandelwal> Network problems today :x 15:36 <kushalkhandelwal> How was your meeting ? 15:36 <kushalkhandelwal> And how are the new interns ? 15:36 <sdumitriu> Good 15:37 <kushalkhandelwal> :) 15:37 <kushalkhandelwal> So working on something today ? Busy ? 15:38 <sdumitriu> Well, I'm always busy 15:38 <sdumitriu> But I can make time for you 15:38 <kushalkhandelwal> :D 15:39 <kushalkhandelwal> My network ! not letting me work 15:39 <kushalkhandelwal> Planning to switch it 15:39 <kushalkhandelwal> Actually I am having 2 connections at home , and now I have to use WiFi which somehow is not working properly 15:39 <kushalkhandelwal> Anyways I was looking at this 15:39 <kushalkhandelwal> https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/issues/429 15:40 <sdumitriu> Stuck? 15:41 <kushalkhandelwal> In DBWebhomesheet 15:41 <kushalkhandelwal> "className" : $patientClassName, 15:41 <kushalkhandelwal> "translationPrefix" : "patient.livetable." 15:41 <kushalkhandelwal> I can see this 15:41 <kushalkhandelwal> patient.livetable is appended in front of all column names 15:41 <sdumitriu> Yep 15:42 <sdumitriu> Did you find where the translations are defined? 15:42 <kushalkhandelwal> Looking for that 15:42 <kushalkhandelwal> http://localhost:8080/bin/edit/PhenoTips/LiveTableResults 15:42 <kushalkhandelwal> Looking at this 15:42 <sdumitriu> Well, it's simple 15:43 <sdumitriu> Just search for patient.livetable. on the filesystem 15:43 <kushalkhandelwal> How do I search that ? 15:43 <kushalkhandelwal> Oh yes 15:43 <kushalkhandelwal> I had to ask 15:43 <kushalkhandelwal> how to search 15:43 <kushalkhandelwal> I look for different files and look in them 15:43 <sdumitriu> You're on Linux, right? 15:43 <kushalkhandelwal> Yep 15:44 <kushalkhandelwal> I used to do that on github 15:44 <kushalkhandelwal> is there a way in XWiki to search ? 15:44 <sdumitriu> Yep 15:44 <sdumitriu> http://localhost:8080/bin/Main/Search 15:45 <sdumitriu> I use a nice little tool called Midnight Commander (mc) 15:45 <sdumitriu> And it has the option to search files and look in the content 15:45 <kushalkhandelwal> Oh nice 15:48 <sdumitriu> Found something? 15:48 <kushalkhandelwal> Yes 15:48 <kushalkhandelwal> I am looking in the translations page 15:49 <sdumitriu> Good 15:51 <kushalkhandelwal> I need to define the ones which are not defined ? 15:51 <sdumitriu> Yep 15:51 <sdumitriu> You can usually get the texts from the class 15:52 <sdumitriu> http://localhost:8080/bin/edit/PhenoTips/PatientClass?editor=class 15:52 <sdumitriu> Not all of them should be added, though 15:52 <kushalkhandelwal> Oh 15:52 <kushalkhandelwal> So which ones to be added ? 15:54 <sdumitriu> The ones that would make sense in the livetable... 15:54 <kushalkhandelwal> Hm 15:54 <kushalkhandelwal> Ok 15:54 <kushalkhandelwal> :) 15:54 <sdumitriu> For example Notes not 15:54 <sdumitriu> Pedigree not 15:54 <sdumitriu> All the extended_ columns 15:54 <kushalkhandelwal> Why there are two identifier ? 15:54 <sdumitriu> Indication for referral 15:55 <sdumitriu> One is internal, the other external 15:55 <sdumitriu> It depends which one is needed at the installation 15:55 <sdumitriu> Some already have their patients in another application 15:56 <sdumitriu> So they use an external identifier that we don't care about 15:56 <kushalkhandelwal> Ohh 15:56 <sdumitriu> Others use PhenoTips as the main patient database, so they use the internal identifier 15:57 <kushalkhandelwal> Why don't we remove the irrelevant colums from Form configuration page 15:57 <kushalkhandelwal> for livetable 15:57 <kushalkhandelwal> Oh 15:57 <sdumitriu> Hm, we should, but it's not easy 15:57 <sdumitriu> Since it just lists all the existing class properties 15:57 <sdumitriu> And there's no way to specify that a property is searchable or not 15:58 <kushalkhandelwal> Hmm 16:00 <kushalkhandelwal> Do you remember that place 16:00 <kushalkhandelwal> where I added one field to be enabled/disabled ? 16:00 <kushalkhandelwal> This commit 16:00 <kushalkhandelwal> https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/commit/afb62d6383361f991d12aea265de3fae4e63a049 16:01 <sdumitriu> Yep 16:01 <kushalkhandelwal> Using this we enabled/disabled field in form ? 16:02 <kushalkhandelwal> The option was available in the form configuration ? 16:02 <kushalkhandelwal> Now I remember it was 16:02 <sdumitriu> Yes, it was 16:03 <kushalkhandelwal> I am thinking how to remove the irrelevant columns 16:03 <kushalkhandelwal> Will think more on this 16:03 <kushalkhandelwal> Because for the administrator everything is very cluttered 16:04 <kushalkhandelwal> Which page would contain the code for Form configuration page ? 16:05 <sdumitriu> Hm, hard to say... 16:05 <sdumitriu> Most of the code is in XWiki.AdminSheet 16:05 <kushalkhandelwal> Hmm 16:05 <kushalkhandelwal> So it just runs a loop to display the columns ? 16:05 <sdumitriu> But the display for those properties is in PhenoTips.DBConfigurationClassDisplayer 16:06 <sdumitriu> Yes 16:06 <kushalkhandelwal> And how to use MC ? :P 16:06 <sdumitriu> Did you install it? 16:06 <kushalkhandelwal> Yep 16:06 <sdumitriu> Type mc 16:06 <kushalkhandelwal> Did that 16:06 <kushalkhandelwal> looking in it 16:06 <kushalkhandelwal> File explorer 16:06 <sdumitriu> Look in the menus 16:07 <sdumitriu> Comman -> Find file 16:07 <sdumitriu> I know the key shortcuts, so I don't really know where to find things in the menu... 16:07 <kushalkhandelwal> Hehe 16:07 <kushalkhandelwal> I would learn them :) 16:08 <sdumitriu> Plus, if you're on Ubuntu, I think their console application steals some important keys, like F10 16:08 <sdumitriu> Alt+Shift+? opens the search dialog 16:08 <kushalkhandelwal> I am on Ubuntu 16:08 <sdumitriu> And you can filter by file name and file content 16:08 <kushalkhandelwal> Which OS you use ? 16:08 <sdumitriu> Gentoo 16:09 <kushalkhandelwal> Oh 16:09 <kushalkhandelwal> Never used it 16:09 <sdumitriu> With KDE 16:09 <kushalkhandelwal> Installing it was such a pain when I tried last year :P 16:10 <sdumitriu> What, Gentoo? 16:10 <sdumitriu> Or KDE? 16:10 <kushalkhandelwal> My laptops just boils on Linux 16:10 <kushalkhandelwal> Gentoo 16:10 <kushalkhandelwal> There were some issues 16:10 <kushalkhandelwal> The only reason we use Ubuntu is 16:10 <kushalkhandelwal> We have a mirror of the repo 16:11 <kushalkhandelwal> A local mirror 16:11 <kushalkhandelwal> so installing and upgrading packages becomes easier 16:11 <kushalkhandelwal> with our net 16:11 <sdumitriu> Yeah, you need to know more about how a Linux OS works to be able to install Gentoo 16:11 <sdumitriu> Yet they have the best documentation I've seen 16:11 <kushalkhandelwal> Hmm 16:12 <kushalkhandelwal> Would try it someday 16:12 <kushalkhandelwal> Any idea how can I control over heating of my laptop ?? 16:12 <sdumitriu> Ubuntu's is mostly a bunch of kids asking random question on a dozen or more forums 16:12 <kushalkhandelwal> I agree 16:13 <kushalkhandelwal> But then it gets easier because of that 16:13 <kushalkhandelwal> Community support is good 16:13 <sdumitriu> Since Gentoo requires some knowledge, most of the users are more advanced and organized, and can formulate a good question and a good answer 16:13 <kushalkhandelwal> Although the way they are commercializing it is sad 16:13 <kushalkhandelwal> I did install Arch once 16:13 <kushalkhandelwal> I liked it 16:15 <kushalkhandelwal> in MC where it shows the results ? 16:19 <kushalkhandelwal> It is 4 at your place temp 11 degree 16:19 <kushalkhandelwal> It is 1 AM at my place temp 29 degree :\ 16:20 <kushalkhandelwal> Now I think even nights are hot 16:45 <sdumitriu> 1AM, and still up? 16:46 <sdumitriu> More like 2:30 now 18:06 <sdumitriu> has quit 19:05 <kushalkhandelwal> has quit 19:20 <sdumitriu1> has quit 19:21 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 21:38 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #phenotips 21:38 <kushalkhandelwal> is now known as <Guest24849> 21:39 <Guest24849> is now known as <kushalk124> 21:39 <kushalk124> clear 21:39 <kushalk124> Hey sdumitriu 21:39 <sdumitriu> Hey 21:39 <sdumitriu> Up already? 21:40 <sdumitriu> Good morning 21:40 <kushalk124> Yes 21:40 <kushalk124> Good morning 21:40 <kushalk124> My mom thought I slept early so she woke me up 21:41 <kushalk124> What you upto ? 21:41 <kushalk124> Working on something ? 21:41 <sdumitriu> Scoring GSoC proposals 21:41 <sdumitriu> Got the email? 21:42 <kushalk124> Yes 21:42 <kushalk124> Reading it :) 21:42 <kushalk124> Just saw that 21:44 <kushalk124> Is tuesday a hard deadline ? 21:44 <sdumitriu> Nope 21:45 <kushalk124> As I am not available from 16th to 20 21:45 <kushalk124> I would start working today only 21:46 <kushalk124> Yayy new task :) 21:50 <kushalk124> How are all the proposals ? 21:50 <kushalk124> And you didn't tell me about the new interns 21:52 <sdumitriu> Well, there are about 10 proposals that we'd like to accept, but we're lacking the slots and the mentors to do that 21:53 <sdumitriu> There are 8 that are really good 21:53 <sdumitriu> 6 that we 21:53 <sdumitriu> 'd really want to accept 21:53 <kushalk124> :) 21:54 <sdumitriu> 4 that I think are really important 21:54 <sdumitriu> Or 5? 21:54 <kushalk124> Ohh 21:54 <sdumitriu> Yes, 5 21:54 <sdumitriu> And that have good chances of success 21:54 <kushalk124> The important ones are ? 21:54 <kushalk124> I think one would be mobile app 21:54 <sdumitriu> Secret 21:54 <kushalk124> hehe :D 21:55 <sdumitriu> Now we'll see which of these 5 finish their tasks 21:55 <kushalk124> Ohh 21:56 <kushalk124> Task is very imp 21:56 <kushalk124> I will try to work in 2 days only , from 16th I wont be having laptop also :( 22:28 <kushalk124> sdumitriu, Busy ? 22:29 <sdumitriu> Shoot 22:30 <kushalk124> So in the measurement section we would have a dropbox to select the unit system ? 22:30 <sdumitriu> Yes 22:30 <sdumitriu> Or radios 22:30 <kushalk124> If imperial selected we would change the field inputs along with the labels ? 22:31 <kushalk124> But the value to server would pe passed in Imperial only ? 22:31 <sdumitriu> No, metric only 22:31 <kushalk124> So if we pass that in metric 22:31 <kushalk124> But the user chose imperial 22:32 <kushalk124> When he would export PDF 22:32 <kushalk124> then ? 22:32 <kushalk124> Would it be in imperial or metric ? 22:32 <sdumitriu> Imperial, but don't worry about that 22:32 <sdumitriu> That's a different task 22:32 <kushalk124> I was just thinking about that :) 22:32 <sdumitriu> And there are a few other related tasks 22:32 <kushalk124> Ok 22:33 <sdumitriu> But the most important one is allowing users to enter data in those units 22:33 <kushalk124> Yep 22:34 <sdumitriu> (actually doctors don't care about imperial units, it's just that they receive old measurements from smaller regional hospitals that don't know metric, but they don't want to convert themselves to metric) 22:35 <sdumitriu> (so it's OK if after the data is entered and converted to metric, it will only be displayed as metric from that point on) 22:35 <sdumitriu> When we'll get users asking for imperial display, we might add support for that as well 22:36 <sdumitriu> But don't take this the wrong way, it's very good that you're thinking about this 22:36 <sdumitriu> A good software engineer should always think about all the implications of a choice 22:41 <kushalk124> :) 22:42 <kushalk124> I was thinking what other changes needs to be implemented if we switch to imperial 22:42 <sdumitriu> has quit 22:42 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 22:42 <kushalk124> I wanted to ask one more thing 22:43 <kushalk124> Not related to this task 22:43 <sdumitriu> Shoot 22:44 <kushalk124> How is the anonymized patient phenotype data collected ? 22:44 <sdumitriu> Simple 22:45 <kushalk124> And how is the data used ? 22:45 <sdumitriu> Right now big hospitals already have a huge EHR software package where they securely hold private data 22:46 <sdumitriu> Then they use phenotips as a side project where they don't enter any PII (Personally identifiable information), just phenotypes 22:47 <sdumitriu> And they use the "external identifier" field that we talked about to say which patient from the private EHR is described here 22:47 <kushalk124> Oh 22:47 <sdumitriu> Then this data can be shared between research institutions, since it's just abstract data which can't be used to identify individuals 22:48 <kushalk124> In UofT lab this data is used for research ? To study about genetic diseases ? 22:48 <kushalk124> How is that done ? 22:48 <sdumitriu> The main kind of usage that we see for PhenoTips right now is for large collaborative studies for identifying rare diseases 22:49 <sdumitriu> And we mean rare 22:49 <sdumitriu> Like, one-two cases per country 22:49 <kushalk124> I have a great interest in how ML and ANN can be used in medicinal purposes 22:49 <kushalk124> As in I have a good interest in Data 22:49 <sdumitriu> When you have so few people with a disease, there's very little that one doctor can do 22:49 <kushalk124> how it can utilized to gather some useful information 22:49 <kushalk124> Yep 22:50 <sdumitriu> But when pooling together resources from different countries, it's more likely to be able to pinpoint the genetic mutations that affect all the individuals 22:50 <kushalk124> Rare diseases 22:50 <kushalk124> and mutations 22:51 <sdumitriu> The problem is that there is no such thing as a "standard" genome 22:51 <sdumitriu> Everybody has many variations 22:51 <sdumitriu> And we haven't analyzed enough genomes to see what is good and what is bad 22:52 <sdumitriu> So it's almost impossible to say just from one individual which of the thousands of differences from the few reference genomes that we have is the likely cause for some symptoms 22:53 <kushalk124> Yep you need more data on that 22:53 <kushalk124> To be more accurate you need more data 22:53 <sdumitriu> Right 22:53 <kushalk124> and hence PhenoTips 22:53 <sdumitriu> Once you have good data, you can put different teams to work on it 22:54 <sdumitriu> A team in our lab is studying "copy number variations" 22:54 <sdumitriu> That means that the DNA is not just a unique chain, it's normal for many regions to be present in several copies 22:55 <sdumitriu> And having more or less copies than it's "normal" affects the body 22:55 <sdumitriu> The problem is that with the current sequencing machines it's hard to detect CNVs 22:55 <sdumitriu> Since sequencing is already done by multiplying thousands of times each piece of DNA 22:56 <kushalk124> Hm 22:56 <kushalk124> Yes , you have to replicate data 22:57 <sdumitriu> OK, I'm going to sleep 22:57 <sdumitriu> How's the progress on the translations issue? 22:57 <kushalk124> So we detect the variations ? 22:57 <kushalk124> Oh ok :) 22:58 <kushalk124> Will complete it today 22:58 <kushalk124> I slept yesterday while working on it :P 22:58 <kushalk124> At home it gets hard to be awake :D 22:58 <sdumitriu> K 22:58 <sdumitriu> Bye 22:58 <kushalk124> 1 more week at home 22:58 <kushalk124> Ok 22:58 <kushalk124> Bye 22:58 <kushalk124> Good night :)
